subject: Re: [junit] Re: Need info on GUI testing
msgSnippet: Hi, ... I feel I should point out that jfcUnit has not seen any development in several years (as in not a single commit to CVS) whereas Abbot development has
messageBody:
Hi,

On 3/9/07, Joe Schmetzer <joe@...> wrote:
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "moin_m19" <moin_m19@...> wrote:
> > I am new to Junit. I am working on a project which involves Applets.
> > [...] In such case how JUnit can be implemented?
>
> David Saff recently suggested Abbot on this list, and you've already
> heard about jfcUnit. I suggest you look over the examples given in
> those projects and see how they are used.

I feel I should point out that jfcUnit has not seen any development in
several years (as in not a single commit to CVS) whereas Abbot
development has recently picked up a little.

Also, the NetBeans team has developed a library similar to
Abbot/jfcUnit called Jemmy (http://jemmy.netbeans.org) that has been
my personal favorite for some time.


Lasse
